alert.note: Alert for Owsley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 28 at 10:31AM EDT until July 29 at 11:13AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Breathitt, Knott, Owsley and Perry. * WHEN...Until 145 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1030 AM EDT, trained weather spotters reported slow moving thunderstorms with very heavy rainfall across the warned area. Between 3 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Booneville, Buckhorn, Whick, Little, Saldee, Wolf Coal, Copland, Howard Creek, Altro, Bush Branch, Barwick, Haddix, Curt, Canoe, Beech, Watts, Talbert, Lost Creek, Crockettsville and Sebastian`s Branch.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
